Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: WellCare Health Plans Inc. agreed to pay $137.5 million to the federal government and nine states to resolve four lawsuits alleging violations of the False Claims Act by falsely inflating the amount it claimed to be spending on medical care in order to avoid returning money to Medicaid and other programs in various states, including the Florida Medicaid and Florida Healthy Kids programs; knowingly retaining overpayments it had received from Florida Medicaid for infant care; and falsifying data that misrepresented the medical conditions of patients and the treatments they received.
Agency: Justice Department Civil Division

Description: Health Net (an insurance company) agreed to pay $166,671 in restitution in settlement of allegations it illegally collected money from its enrollees' personal injury awards. State law prevented insurance companies from recovering these costs but required that medical costs already paid by insurance be deducted from personal injury awards.
Agency: Connecticut Attorney General
New York Attorney General
New York Attorney General

Company: Health Net of the Northeast, Inc. et al.
Description: Health Net agreed to pay $250,000 in settlement of allegations it failed to secure private medical records and financial information and failed to promptly notify customers and authorities of a data breach.
Agency: Connecticut Attorney General

Description: To resolve a case involving allegations of unfair health insurance reimbursement rates, Health Net agreed to pay $1.6 million to a qualified nonprofit organization that would establish a new, independent database to help determine fair out-of-network reimbursement rates for consumers throughout the United States.
Agency: New York Attorney General

Description: WellCare Health Plans Inc. agreed to pay $137.5 million to nine states and the federal government to resolve four lawsuits alleging violations of the False Claims Act by falsely inflating the amount it claimed to be spending on medical care in order to avoid returning money to Medicaid and other programs in various states. The settlement was also announced by the U.S. Justice Department; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-wellcare-health-plans-inc
Agency: Multistate Attorneys General Case

Description: In a case brought on behalf of state pension funds in Louisiana and New Mexico as well as other investors, WellCare agreed to pay $200 million to settle allegations that fraudulent Medicaid practices harmed shareholders.
Agency: Multistate Attorneys General Case
Info Source: AG King Announces Settlement in NM Securities Case; State Investment Council and PERA to Benefit, Targeted News Service, August 9, 2010 (via Nexis).
